citation.article-title: Legionella impletisoli sp. nov. and Legionella yabuuchiae sp. nov., isolated from soils contaminated with industrial wastes in Japan.

p.s: Description of Legionella yabuuchiae sp. nov.
ya.bu.u.chi’ae. N.L. fem.gen.n.yabuuchiae, in honour of Eiko Yabuuchi for her work on Legionella in Japan.
Gram-negative rod, grows on BCYEα agar, but not on media without l-cysteine.

Positive for oxidase, catalase and gelatinase activities, hydrolysis of hippurate and browning of tyrosine-supplemented agar; negative for reduction of nitrate to nitrite, urease, utilization of glucose.
Contains the saturated fatty acids C15:0 ANTEISO (20.82%), C16:0 ISO (24.89%) and C17:0 ANTEISO (22.61%) as the major fatty acid components.
This species was isolated from soils contaminated with industrial wastes collected from a landfill in Osaka, Japan.
The type strain is strain OA1-2.
It has a G+C content of 41.4%.
